workflow.name: Automated CV screening and scoring with AI, Gmail, GoogleDrive & Airtable
workflow.description:
# **ðŸš€ HR Resume Screening Workflow â€” Smart Hiring on Autopilot ðŸ¤–**

## ðŸŽ¯ **Overview:**

"This workflow builds an AI-powered resume screening system inside n8n. It begins with Gmail and Form triggers that capture incoming resumes, then uploads each file to Google Drive for storage. The resume is downloaded and converted into plain text, where two branches run in parallel: one extracts structured contact details, and the other uses an AI agent to summarize education, job history, and skills while assigning a suitability score. A cleanup step normalizes the data before merging both outputs, and the final candidate record is saved into Google Sheets and Airtable, giving recruiters a centralized dashboard to identify top talent quickly and consistently.â€

## ðŸ”‘ **Prerequisites:**

To run this workflow successfully, youâ€™ll need:

- **Gmail OAuth** â†’ to read incoming resumes.
- **Google Drive OAuth** â†’ to upload and download resume files.
- **Google Sheets OAuth** â†’ to save structured candidate records.
- **Airtable Personal Access Token** â†’ for dashboards and record-keeping.
- **OpenAI / OpenRouter API Key** â†’ to run the AI summarizer and evaluator.

## âš™ï¸ **Setup Instructions:**

1. **Import the Workflow**
    - Clone or import the workflow into your n8n instance.
2. **Add Credentials**
    - Go to **n8n â†’ Credentials** and connect Gmail, Google Drive, Google Sheets, Airtable, and OpenRouter/OpenAI.
3. **Configure Key Nodes**
    - **Gmail Trigger** â†’ Update `filters.q` with the job title you are hiring for (e.g., `"Senior Software Engineer"`).
    - **Google Drive Upload** â†’ Set the `folderId` where resumes will be stored.
    - **Google Sheets Node** â†’ Link to your HR spreadsheet (e.g., â€œCandidates 2025â€).
    - **Airtable Node** â†’ Select the correct base & table schema for candidate records.
4. **Test the Workflow**
    - Send a test resume (via email or form).
    - Check Google Sheets & Airtable for structured candidate data.
5. **Go Live**
    - Enable the workflow. It will now run continuously and process new resumes as they arrive.

# **ðŸ“Š End-to-End Workflow Walkthrough:**

### ðŸŸ¢ **Section 1 â€“ Entry & Intake**

**Nodes:**

- ðŸ“§ **Gmail Trigger** â†’ Polls inbox every minute, captures job application emails, and downloads resume attachments (`CV0, CV1, â€¦`).
- ðŸŒ **Form Trigger** â†’ Alternate entry for resumes submitted via a careers page or job portal.

âœ… **Quick Understanding:** Think of this section as the **front desk of recruitment** - resumes received either by email or online form, and the system immediately grabs them for processing.

---

### ðŸ“‚ **Section 2 â€“ File Management**

**Nodes:**

- â˜ï¸ **Upload File (Google Drive)** â†’ Saves the incoming resume into a structured Google Drive folder, naming it after the applicant.
- â¬‡ï¸ **Download File (Google Drive)** â†’ Retrieves the stored resume file for further processing.
- ðŸ”Ž **Extract from File** â†’ Converts the resume (PDF/DOC) into plain text so the AI and extractors can work with it.

âœ… **Quick Understanding:** This is your **digital filing room.** Every resume is safely stored, then converted into a readable format for the hiring system.

---

### ðŸ¤– **Section 3 â€“ AI Processing (Parallel Analysis)**

**Nodes:**

- ðŸ§¾ **Information Extractor** â†’ Pulls structured contact information (candidate name, candidate email and candidate phone number) using regex validation and schema rules.
- ðŸ¤– **AI Agent (LangChain + OpenRouter)** â†’ Reads the full CV and outputs:
    - ðŸŽ“ Educational Qualifications
    - ðŸ’¼ Job History
    - ðŸ›  Skills Set
    - ðŸ“Š Candidate Evaluation Score (1â€“10)
    - ðŸ“ Justification for the score

âœ… **Quick Understanding:** Imagine having two assistants working in parallel, one quickly extracts basic contact info, while the other deeply reviews the CV and gives an evaluation.

---

### ðŸ› ï¸ **Section 4 â€“ Data Cleanup & Merging**

**Nodes:**

- âœï¸ **Edit Fields** â†’ Standardizes the AI Agentâ€™s output into a consistent field (`output`).
- ðŸ›  **Code (JS Parsing & Cleanup)** â†’ Converts the AIâ€™s free-text summary into clean JSON fields (`education`, `jobHistory`, `skills`, `score`, `justification`).
- ðŸ”— **Merge** â†’ Combines the structured contact info with the AIâ€™s evaluation into a single candidate record.

âœ… **Quick Understanding:** This is like the **data cleaning and reporting team,** making sure all details are neat, structured, and merged into one complete candidate profile.

---

### ðŸ“Š **Section 5 â€“ Persistence & Dashboards**

**Nodes:**

- ðŸ“‘ **Google Sheets (Append Row)** â†’ Saves candidate details into a Google Sheet for quick team access.
- ðŸ—„ **Airtable (Create Record)** â†’ Stores the same structured data into Airtable, enabling dashboards, analytics, and ATS-like tracking.

âœ… **Quick Understanding:** Think of this as your **HR dashboard and database.** Every candidate record is logged in both Google Sheets and Airtable, ready for filtering, reporting, or further action.

---

## ðŸ“Š **Workflow Overview Table:**

| **Section** | **Key Roles / Nodes** | **Model / Service** | **Purpose** | **Benefit** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| ðŸ“¥ **Entry & Intake** | Gmail Trigger, Form Trigger | Gmail API / Webhook | Capture resumes from email or forms | Resumes collected instantly from multiple sources |
| ðŸ“‚ **File Management** | Google Drive Upload, Google Drive Download, Extract from File | Google Drive + n8n Extract | Store resumes & convert to plain text | Centralized storage + text extraction for processing |
| ðŸ¤– **AI Processing** | Information Extractor, AI Agent (LangChain + OpenRouter) | Regex + OpenRouter AI {gpt-oss-20b (free)} | Extract contact info + AI CV analysis | Candidate details + score + justification generated automatically |
| ðŸ›  **Data Cleanup & Merge** | Edit Fields, Code (JS Parsing & Cleanup), Merge | n8n native + Regex Parsing | Standardize and merge outputs | Clean, structured JSON record with all candidate info |
| ðŸ“Š **Persistence Layer** | Google Sheets Append Row, Airtable Create Record | Google Sheets + Airtable APIs | Store structured candidate data | HR dashboards & ATS-ready records for easy review and analytics |
| ðŸ”„ **Execution Flow** | All connected | Gmail + Drive + Sheets + Airtable + AI | End-to-end automation | Automated resume â†’ structured record â†’ recruiter dashboards |

---

## ðŸ“‚ **Workflow Output Overview:**

Each candidateâ€™s data is standardized into the following fields:

- Candidate Name
- Candidate Email
- Contact Number
- Educational Qualifications
- Job History
- Skills Set
- AI Score (1â€“10)
- Justification

ðŸ“Œ Example (Google Sheet row):

![HR_Resume_Screening_Excel_Row.png](fileId:2670)

## **ðŸ“Š Benefits of This Workflow at a Glance:**

- **â±ï¸ Lightning-Fast Screening** â†’ Processes hundreds of resumes in minutes instead of hours.
- **ðŸ¤– AI-Powered Evaluation** â†’ Automatically summarizes candidate education, work history, skills, and gives a suitability score (1â€“10) with justification.
- **ðŸ“‚ Centralized Storage** â†’ Every resume is securely saved in Google Drive for easy access and record-keeping.
- **ðŸ“Š Data-Ready Outputs** â†’ Structured candidate profiles go straight into Google Sheets and Airtable, ready for dashboards and analytics.
- **âœ… Consistency & Fairness** â†’ Standardized AI scoring ensures every candidate is evaluated on the same criteria, reducing human bias.
- **ðŸ› ï¸ Flexible Intake** â†’ Works with both Gmail (email applications) and Form submissions (job portals or career pages).
- **ðŸš€ Recruiter Productivity Boost** â†’ Frees HR teams from manual extraction and data entry, allowing them to focus on interviewing and hiring the best talent.

## **ðŸ‘‰ Practical HR Use Case:**

**â€œScreen resumes for a Senior Software Engineer role and shortlist top candidates.â€**

- Gmail Trigger â†’ Captures incoming job applications with CVs attached.
- Google Drive â†’ Stores resumes for record-keeping.
- Extract from File â†’ Converts CVs into plain text.
- Information Extractor â†’ Pulls candidate name, email, and phone number.
- AI Agent â†’ Summarizes education, job history, skills, and assigns a suitability score (1â€“10).
- Code & Merge â†’ Cleans and combines outputs into a structured candidate profile.
- Google Sheets â†’ Logs candidate data for quick HR review.
- Airtable â†’ Builds dashboards to filter and identify top-scoring candidates.

âœ… **Result:** HR instantly sees structured candidate records, filters by score, and focuses interviews on the best talent.

options.systemMessage:
=YOU ARE THE WORLD'S MOST ACCURATE AND EFFICIENT CV SUMMARIZER, KNOWN FOR PRODUCING CONCISE AND INFORMATIVE SUMMARIES THAT CAPTURE ALL ESSENTIAL DETAILS.
YOUR TASK IS TO SUMMARIZE A PROVIDED CV INTO THREE CLEAR SECTIONS: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS, JOBN HISTORY, AND SKILL SET. IN ADDITION, YOU MUST EVALUATE THE CANDIDATE'S SUITABILITY FOR A SPECIFIED JOB ROLE AND ASSIGN A SCORE FROM 1 TO 10 BASED ON HOW WELL THEIR QUALIFICATIONS MATCH THE ROLE.

INSTRUCTIONS
1. EXTRACT AND SUMMARIZE INFORMATION FROM THE CV:
EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: INCLUDE DEGREE NAMES, INSTITUTIONS, AND GRADUATION YEARS.
JOB HISTORY: LIS JOB TITLES, COMPANIES, AND EMPLOYMENT DATES, WITH A BRIEF OVERVIEW OF KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OR ACHIEVEMENTS.
SKILL SET: COMPLETE RELEVANT TECHNICAL, SOFT, AND INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC SKILLS.

2. EVALUATE THE CANDIDATE BASED ON THE PROVIDED JOB POST:
ANALYZE RELEVANCE: Compare the candidate's education, work experience, and skill set with the provided job post.
ASSIGN A SCORE (1-10):
1-3: Weak match (lacks key qualifications or experience).
4-6: Moderate match (some relevant qalifications but gaps exists).
7-8: Strong match (meets most job criteria with relevant experience).
9-10: Excellent match (perfect fit exceeding expectations).

PROVIDE A BRIEF JUSTIFICATION for the assigned score, highlighting key strengths or missing qualifications.

3. OUTPUT FORMAT:
Educational Qualifications

[Degree], [Institution], [Year]
Job History

[Job Title], [Company], [Dates]: [Key responsibilities or Achievements]
Skill Ste

[Skill 1], [Skill 2], [Skill 3], [Skill 4], etc.
Candidates Evaluation

Score: [1-10]
Justification: [Brief explanation of why the candidate received this score]
WHAT TO DO
DO NOT INCLUDE PERSONAL INFORMATION such as contact details or addresses.
DO NOT OMIT RELEVANT EDUCATION, JOB, OR SKILL INFORMATION.
DO NOT ADD YOUR OWN INTERPRETATION OR ASSUMPTIONS ABOUT THE CV CONTENT.
DO NOT USE INFORMAL LANGUAGE OR EXCESSIVE DETAIL.
EXAMPLE OUTPUT:
Educational Qualifications

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, University of Karachi, 2020.
Job History

Software Engineer, Techcorp, 2021-2025: Developed Scalable web applications and optimized database performance.
Skill Set

Python, Javascript, React, ReactNative, n8n, Zapier, AI, LLM, Team Leadership, Agile Development.
Candidate Evaluation

Score: 8/10
Justification: The candidate has a relevant degree, strong technical skills, and 12 years of industry experience. However, lacks experience with cloud technologies mentioned in the job description.

Job Post:
Weâ€™re seeking a talented and driven Full-Stack Developer with solid experience in Next.js, SAAS Development, Supabase etc. to join our growing team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building and maintaining scalable, high-performance web applications and backend systems.

Key Responsibilities:
â€¢	Develop and scale web applications using Next.js.
â€¢	Build backend infrastructure using Supabase (database, authentication, storage, etc.).
â€¢	Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a SaaS product environment.
â€¢	Integrate AI tools and workflows to enhance development efficiency and innovation.
â€¢	Write optimized, maintainable SQL queries and design robust data structures.
â€¢	Analyze and work with existing codebases to extend features or resolve issues.
â€¢	Ensure system performance, stability, and security through best practices.

Ideal Candidate should have:
â€¢	3+ years of professional development experience.
â€¢	A Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a relevant Field.
â€¢	Strong proficiency in Next.js and Supabase.
â€¢	Demonstrated experience in SaaS application development.
â€¢	Ability to read and work with existing codebases.
â€¢	Good understanding of authentication, authorization, and middleware.
â€¢	Proficiency in SQL, database schema design, and performance tuning.
â€¢	Actively incorporates AI tools (like Copilot, ChatGPT, etc.) into development processes.
â€¢	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

What we Offer:
â€¢	Competitive compensation
â€¢	Opportunity to work on innovative, AI-powered tools and services
â€¢	Collaborative, fast-paced, and growth-focused environment
Interested candidates can share the Resume to baluntechsol@gmail.com with the Position mentioned in the Subject line.

If you are interested, please feel free to DM me or email your Resume to baluntechsol@gmail.com with the Position mentioned in the Subject line.

parameters.content:
GMAIL TRIGGER:
Listen from emails or forms submissions matching the CV's received for specific job position and fetch attachments.

UPLOAD THE FILE:
Incoming attachment (CV) is uploaded to the configured Google Drive folder and named from the sender.

DOWNLOAD THE ATTACHMENT (CV):
The stored file is downloaded by ID so it can be read.

EXTRACT FROM FILE:
Extract from File converts the CV (PDF) into plain text.

Two parallel AI paths:

Quick structured extraction: Information Extractor uses a small schema (name, email, phone) + LM helper to pull contact fields.

Full CV analysis: AI Agent runs a large system prompt to summarize Education, Job History, Skills and to assign a suitability score (1â€“10).
Normalize agent output: Edit Fields maps the agent response into output.

Parse & clean: 
Code runs JS to extract the three summary sections plus score and justification from the agent text (regex-based).

Merge datasets: 
Merge combines the schema extraction (contact info) with the AI-parsed summary/score.

Store results: 
Final record is appended to Google Sheets and inserted into Airtable for tracking, reporting, or downstream workflows.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
